@D3x7er .      . 
   - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc
   . 

     :


Follow the steps below to fully uninstall AdGuard for Safari: 
1. Uncheck all AdGuard for Safari extensions in **Safari -> Preferences -> Extensions** (if available)
2. Open **Finder** and press Shift+Command+G
    - Remove AdGuardSafariApp folder from **~/Library/Application Support** directory
    - Remove from **~/Library/Containers** - all directories started with AdGuard-
    - Remove TC3Q7MAJXF.com.adguard.safari.AdGuard folder from **~/Library/GroupContainers** directory
    - Remove com.adguard.safari.AdGuard.plist from **~/Library/Preferences** 
3. Open **Activity Monitor** and force quit all "cfprefsd" processes 
4. Remove AdGuard for Safari from **Applications**

This issue is has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/393

Please wait until it is solved there.

If youre using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, youre probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

[Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
[Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

<hr>

You can also use the instructions in the [comment above](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/152739#issuecomment-1575409473)
